Trial_Design.evidence: The study is a randomized, controlled trial with a nonrandomized arm for patients who are eligible but decline randomization.

Participants.evidence: Two hundred fifty patients (159 randomized) with CSM from 11 sites will be recruited over 18 months.

Intervention.evidence: to determine if ventral surgery is associated with superior SF-36 Physical Component Summary (PCS) outcome at one year follow-up compared to dorsal (laminectomy/fusion or laminoplasty) surgery

Objective.evidence: The primary objective is to determine if ventral surgery is associated with superior SF-36 Physical Component Summary (PCS) outcome at one year follow-up compared to dorsal (laminectomy/fusion or laminoplasty) surgery for the treatment of CSM.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome is the Short Form-36 PCS score.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Two hundred fifty patients (159 randomized) with CSM from 11 sites will be recruited over 18 months.

Funding.evidence: The final protocol was approved for funding by PCORI (CE-1304-6173).
